rooms.name: Entrance Hall
rooms.description: Large entrance hall with minimalist design and raw concrete finishes typical of Brutalist style. This area serves as a transition space from the exterior to the interior, with floor-to-ceiling windows on one side to allow natural light.

rooms.name: Living Room
rooms.description: Spacious living room integrated with an open layout that flows into the kitchen and dining area. It features floor-to-ceiling windows to enhance brightness and a view of the exterior.

rooms.name: Dining Area
rooms.description: A dedicated dining space adjacent to the living room with raw concrete surfaces and exposed brick, aligning with the Brutalist aesthetic. Vastu principles are applied by orienting this area towards the east for positive energy flow.

rooms.name: Dining Kitchen
rooms.description: The kitchen is designed to be functional yet aesthetically aligned with Brutalist elements. It includes floor-to-ceiling windows that provide ample natural light and a seamless integration with the dining area.

rooms.name: Guest Bedroom
rooms.description: A guest bedroom that adheres to Brutalist design through its use of raw materials. It includes a spacious balcony for relaxation and fresh air, oriented towards the north as per Vastu recommendations.

rooms.name: Home Office
rooms.description: A dedicated home office with floor-to-ceiling windows to maximize natural light. The room is designed for minimal distraction while maintaining the overall Brutalist aesthetic using concrete and metal finishes.

rooms.name: Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow corridor connecting all rooms on the ground floor, constructed with exposed concrete to maintain continuity in design. This area helps in efficient circulation while following Vastu guidelines for movement.

rooms.name: WC
rooms.description: Utility bathroom and WC area placed strategically near the entrance or service areas to maintain a balance according to Vastu principles.

openings.description: Floor-to-ceiling window in the living room for maximum natural light and views.
Spacious balcony attached to each bedroom as per design requirements. These balconies allow for ventilation and relaxation in alignment with Vastu principles.
Window on the west-facing wall to capture evening light while balancing the heat as per local building norms and Vastu.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: The master bedroom features floor-to-ceiling windows to maximize natural light and ventilation. A spacious balcony is integrated for relaxation.

rooms.name: Bedroom 2
rooms.description: A secondary bedroom with a dedicated balcony designed in the Brutalist style using raw materials. The window placements align with Vastu principles by favoring north or east orientations.

rooms.name: Bedroom 3
rooms.description: A bedroom designed similarly to Bedroom 2, complete with a balcony and ample natural light. Floor-to-ceiling windows are incorporated for modern aesthetics.

rooms.name: Balcony Corridor
rooms.description: A corridor connecting all bedroom balconies on the first floor, allowing for efficient circulation and adherence to Vastu principles.

openings.description: Each bedroom has its own spacious balcony designed for relaxation and ventilation, in line with Vastu and the Brutalist aesthetic.
Floor-to-ceiling windows on the east wall to enhance natural light in each bedroom.
